channel.title: Wysiwyg?
channel.description: hey i wanted a WYSIWYG [what you see is what you get] like DW CS3. But my trail expired :P and i cant seem to find serial. Anywaz i was wondering if you guys know any programs ?

item.dc:creator: @robocz033 robocz033
item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

yea…too bad…cuz warez is bad coughtcoughgoodcoughcough…too bad.

item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

robocz033:

i get what you mean…i just use limewire because its easy, i find those kinds of sites sometimes confusing because of all the things and flashy stuff, i find i get distracted!

Yes…too bad warez is against the rules.

item.title: Wysiwyg?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Limewire is full of fail tbh.

I mean if it weren’t against the rules, you could always goto mscracks.com although it is full of bad ads, if you catch my drift…but that was if it wasn’t against the rules.

Read full topic

item.title: Wysiwyg?
item.dc:creator: @robocz033 robocz033
item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

limewire is your friend here…not suggesting anything, just that limewire is your friend.
i learned using notepad and now i use dreamweaver 8 on my pc and dreamweaver mx on my mac. yea, learning using notepad was a toughy cuz i had to edit, save, refresh. and that was no fun. so the split view on dreamweaver is nice so i can see what im doing, but doing it in design mode confuses me and code is just code and i like to see my site cuz it helps me think.
but check limewire…cuz i had an extra serial, but idk where it is. ill look tho.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Exception, post:11, topic:144823”]http://www.torrentz.com
Wait, what, who said that? ;)[/quote]can you give me some serials? lol. Unless its off rules coughpm mecough and it would be cool if there was a mac flash 8 serial layin around… hmm lol… torrents take to long. and i dont want to portfoward lol.

item.title: Wysiwyg?
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:8, topic:144823”][quote author=Sick of Air link=topic=198425.msg1768318#msg1768318 date=1190263054]
Well, I learned my HTML from WYSIWYG programs… Then again I altered the HTML instead of the preview itself… Ah well…
[/quote]

The emphasis was on the WYSIWYG part. I currently use DW CS3, which is a WYSIWYG program, true, but I don’t use the design or split part at all.[/quote]
I hate refreshing in firefox every edit…
design is good for a rough look of the site (NOT TO EDIT!!!)

though…i do like its table mode…i really hate splitting rows and shit by hand.

Read full topic

item.title: Wysiwyg?

Well, I learned my HTML from WYSIWYG programs… Then again I altered the HTML instead of the preview itself… Ah well…
[/quote]

The emphasis was on the WYSIWYG part. I currently use DW CS3, which is a WYSIWYG program, true, but I don’t use the design or split part at all.[/quote]
I only use the design when I want to see how I’m coming along with it Anyways, I think we got a bit off-topic O.o

item.title: Wysiwyg?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Sick of Air:

Well, I learned my HTML from WYSIWYG programs… Then again I altered the HTML instead of the preview itself… Ah well…

The emphasis was on the WYSIWYG part. I currently use DW CS3, which is a WYSIWYG program, true, but I don’t use the design or split part at all.

item.title: Wysiwyg?
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:6, topic:144823”][quote author=Sick of Air link=topic=198425.msg1768025#msg1768025 date=1190256634]
I know HTML and am in the process of learning CSS, but I find WYSIWYG programs much more convenient
[/quote]

So what are you trying to say? That beginners choose what’s easy over what’s right?

WYSIWYG programs only impair your html abilities. If you get used to WYSIWYG programs, you’ll find it easy when the code produced is horrible.[/quote]
Well, I learned my HTML from WYSIWYG programs… Then again I altered the HTML instead of the preview itself… Ah well…

Read full topic

I know HTML and am in the process of learning CSS, but I find WYSIWYG programs much more convenient

So what are you trying to say? That beginners choose what’s easy over what’s right?

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

WYSIWYGs are for people who can’t code websites.
You should be previewing in real browsers, and you should be editing the source.
